page.title: 09CRUCKMEOLE FARM
page.content:
This{110 acre}farm has 12 fields which are separated by local roads. The soil is{medium loam.}One third of the fields drain well, two thirds have buried pipes. Most of the fields are bounded by hedges or the brook. The field water supply is from either the brook or mains water supply. The fields are used for grazing, growing corn, soft fruit and potatoes.
{FARMERS FAMILY. The owner of the farm has farmed at Cruckmeole for 26 years. He has 3 children. Two of them go to Hanwood Primary School. His son helps on the farm by putting out the straw in the cow cubicle house, whilst his daughter cleans the milking parlour.
